I allow my employees flexibility in lunch time, breaks, sick days, family leave, further education, etc.
I don't believe in micromanaging.  It puts undue stress on employees.
I train, coach and mentor but I don’t have the time to micromanage.
If you hired someone, it means you believe they are capable of doing the job. Then trust them to get the job done.  You don’t need to be constantly monitoring their every movement.
The best ideas and advancements are a result of empowering your team.
Read full post – Never push loyal employees to the point they no longer care! https://lnkd.in/d-pscjb
Micromanagement suffocates, demoralises and kills creativity.
Select the right people and give them room to get the job done.

Starting your day off right can really improve your attitude and your well-being. Remember to make a healthy choice today. Every great adventure starts with a single step. Start your adventure on your journey to the better version of you.

Yesterday morning I was getting ready for one of the most important meetings of my life. Tied the tie, checked the hair, spritzed some cologne, and my phone rang. I recognized the number. It was the client.
I was bummed. My paperwork and research was legit. My suit game was on point. And then I was sitting on my bed with almost nothing to do.
My wife had asked me to park in her parking garage downtown for my meeting so I could get her a different pair of shoes and her favorite garlic Triscuits. #husbandry101

I texted her the bad news but told her I'd still bring her down her stuff. I brought my work bag, stayed suited up, dropped off her things and shot the breeze for a few minutes, kissed her and went prospecting.
I started the day with one potential client. I ended the day with 3 and one of them has the  potential to be many factors higher than the one that rescheduled.
To quote my favorite rapper Big Sean:
"Last night took an L but tonight I bounced back!"(His song Bounce Back is on my hype playlist)
Don't let Negativity Bias hold you back.
You can make something out of nothing if you want it bad enough.
